text: Vladimir Putin likes to surprise the
world and he's done it again President
Assad's visit to Moscow was kept top
secret until it was over
and the Syrian leader had flown home at
their meeting President Putin said
Russian airstrikes in Syria had been
effective a long-term settlement can be
reached in the end through the political
process with the participation of all
political ethnic and religious forces
ultimately the final decision is up to
the Syrian people seriously
said he was hugely grateful to Russia
terrorism which has now spread
throughout the region would have taken
much larger areas and would have spread
throughout the territory and beyond if
it were not for your actions and your
decisions this is what President Assad
came to say thank you for russian
airpower three weeks of airstrikes have
made it possible for the syrian army to
go on the offensive
to try to retake territory that have
been lost to the rebels Moscow says that
in Syria its Air Force is bombing
terrorists the West accuses Russia of
targeting opponents of President Assad
for now most Russians support their
country's military intervention in Syria
believing in the Kremlin's promise that
it won't put Russian troops on the
ground in Syria this was a brief
encounter but by hosting President Assad
President Putin was sending a very clear
message to the West that Moscow is once
again a key player in the Middle East
and that there can be no solution to the
Syrian conflict without Russia's
involvement Steve Rosenberg BBC news
Moscow
